Author: hastrup#8742
Content: I don't care that much what dwy. But what I care about is the selling and buying of the nn there should be a clear rule set what is allow and not. If someone misbehave there should be a vote between the nn and if they agree that x nn have done something wrong then a new public vote should happen for that nn.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: generally speaking it is not allowed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only in special circumstances are exception allowed and the team ends up buying it and not using it for notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is impossible to have rules to cover all possible scenarios, at least not without spending a lot of time and effort to create such a set of rules. so we use the practical approach and deal with these edge cases on a case by case basis

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are 64 NN spots, so losing a few is well within the system design. it has built in redundancy

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: @jl777c ho decidede what is a special circumstance or a personal attack is? Is it one or many that decide? And what about the person that lost the spot whit one vote. should that person not get the chance to prove how good a nn they go be. While there is a nn just doing nothing. Somone voted for dwy, we are not respecting there wish for him to be a nn. their votes should not go to waste, they should get a chance to vote again for somone else then. I can understand that is not that feasible. But I sound like there is room for improvement in the future.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is unfortunate that elected notaries sometimes end up in a situation where they are not able to do what they promised to do and insist on getting paid for their spots. each year there seem to be a few spots like this, but the alternate NN isnt in a position to pay for it. last year, we had an alternate NN take over one of the spots. as i say it is impossible to know how best to handle all possible things, we just try to do the best we can with each situation.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @hastrup if there is indeed an NN candidate that just missed out and wants one of the spots, they can contact me, but so far nobody has

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a sense the people that voted for the NN who bailed out, that is who they voted for. why should they get to vote again?

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: I don't know if there are a nn that almost got in but I could imagine. Why should the people get to vote again. Thats a good question. In my mind it just sounds fair that if it nn is removed involuntary they are not getting what they voted on. I just don't like it possible to buy the nn that is what I'm the most concerned about. There should be something next in line if someone misbehave.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nobody was removed involuntarily

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in fact, it was insisted over and over again, that the NN spots "had to be sold"
